name: Backpack
description: A sturdy leather pack with straps to wear on your back. It can hold up to 1 cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear.

name: Bedroll
description: A portable, padded sleeping mat for resting comfortably during long journeys or camping.

name: Mess Kit
description: A tin box containing a cup and simple cutlery. The box can be used as a cooking pan and the lid as a plate.

name: Tinderbox
description: A small container holding flint, fire steel, and tinder used to light fires. Using it to light a torch takes an action.

name: Torch
description: A wooden stick capped with cloth soaked in pitch. When lit, it burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius.

name: Rations (1 day)
description: A mix of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

name: Waterskin
description: A leather container used for storing and carrying water or other liquids. It can hold up to 4 pints of liquid.

name: Hempen Rope (50 feet)
description: Strong rope made from hemp fibers. It has AC 11, 2 hit points, and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

name: Crowbar
description: A sturdy iron bar used for prying. It grants advantage on Strength checks where leverage can be applied.

name: Grappling Hook
description: A three-pronged metal hook used for climbing or securing a rope. It can be thrown to catch on battlements or tree branches.

name: Hammer
description: A one-handed hammer with a wooden handle. Useful for pounding in pitons, tent stakes, or other general purposes.

name: Healer's Kit
description: A leather pouch containing bandages, salves, and splints. It has 10 uses and can be used to stabilize a dying creature.

name: Lantern, Hooded
description: A lantern with a hood to control the light. It burns oil and provides bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

name: Oil (flask)
description: A flask of oil that can fuel a lantern for 6 hours. It can also be used as a thrown weapon or to make an area slippery.

name: Piton
description: A small metal spike used for climbing. It can be hammered into cracks or between stones to create an anchor point for ropes.

name: Spyglass
description: A portable telescope that makes distant objects appear closer. Objects viewed through it are magnified to twice their size.

name: Alchemist's Fire (flask)
description: A sticky, adhesive fluid that ignites when exposed to air. As an action, you can throw it up to 20 feet, dealing 1d4 fire damage on a hit.

name: Antitoxin (vial)
description: A creature that drinks this vial of liquid gains advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour.

name: Climber's Kit
description: Includes pitons, boot tips, gloves, and a harness. Gives you advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to climb.

name: Fishing Tackle
description: Includes a wooden rod, silken line, corkwood bobbers, steel hooks, lead sinkers, velvet lures, and narrow netting.

name: Magnifying Glass
description: This lens allows a closer look at small objects. It is also useful as a substitute for flint and steel when starting fires.

name: Portable Ram
description: A handheld battering ram. You can use it to break down doors, giving you a +4 bonus to Strength checks to do so.

name: Thieves' Tools
description: A set of tools for picking locks and disarming traps. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to ability checks made to disarm traps or open locks.
